definition[0]: something that you get legally from your work in addition to your wages, such as goods, meals, or a car
example[1]: I only eat here because it’s free – one of the perks of the job.
example[2]: the perks of working at a large law firm
definition[2]: something in addition to money that you get for doing your job, such as a car
example[3]: bonuses, housing allowances and other perks
example[4]: Employees must pay tax on anything regarded as a perk.
